instruction: Analyze the following veterinary clinical note and predict the SNOMED-CT diagnosis codes.
input: Clinical Note: Dog, 7 years old, Boxer. Seizure episode lasting 2 minutes, post-ictal confusion. Normal between episodes. Blood work pending.

instruction: Determine the diagnosis codes that best match this clinical presentation.
input: Clinical Note: Cat, 1 year old, Domestic Shorthair. Sneezing, nasal discharge, conjunctivitis. Multiple cats in household affected.

instruction: Identify the diagnostic codes based on the clinical notes provided.
input: Clinical Note: Horse, 15 years old, Quarter Horse. Chronic weight loss, poor coat condition, intermittent colic episodes. Dental exam shows severe wear.

instruction: What diagnoses would you assign to this veterinary case using SNOMED-CT codes?
input: Clinical Note: Ferret, 4 years old. Lethargy, enlarged abdomen, difficulty breathing. Spleen feels enlarged on palpation.

instruction: Analyze this veterinary case and predict diagnosis codes.
input: Clinical Note: Dog, 6 years old, German Shepherd. Chronic coughing for 3 weeks, exercise intolerance. Radiographs show enlarged heart silhouette.
